Class Chord

java.lang.Object
  Chord

public class Chord
extends java.lang.Object

A chord is a stack of notes. All chords take up the same rhythmic amount of space.

Version:
3.27.2018
Author:
Annabelle Perng

Constructor Detail

Chord

public Chord(int sixteenthPlace)
Constructor for objects of class Chord.

Parameters:
sixteenthPlace - an integer between 0 and 15 which signifies the rhythmic location of the chord in the measure
Method Detail

chordToText

public java.lang.String chordToText()
Converts the chord to a String format. Starts and ends the String with square brackets, then presents each note value in the chord separated by periods. For example: "[24.22.19]".

Returns:
String format of the chord

findInChord

public int findInChord(Note n)
Checks if a given note is already in 'this' chord.

Parameters:
n - the note to be checked
Returns:
the index within the chord that Note n occupies, if it is in the chord; otherwise, -1

getSixteenthPlace

public int getSixteenthPlace()
Returns an integer between 0 and 15 which signifies the rhythmic location of the chord in the measure.

Returns:
the note's rhythmic location

modifyChord

public void modifyChord(Note n)
Modifies the chord according to the user's input.

Parameters:
n - the note to be added to or removed from the chord

returnChord

public java.util.ArrayList<Note> returnChord()
Returns an ArrayList containing all the notes in the chord.

Returns:
all the notes within the chord
